hm.. strange. why do we need this `total_count`? how it's used? why can't we just use the array in `items`?

Maybe to calculate a number of pages. Looks like we don't need `total_count`, but I can't use `RtPagination` to iterate search results. API returns a json object:

``` sh
$ curl "https://api.github.com/search/repositories?q=tetris+language:assembly&sort=stars&order=desc"
{
  "total_count": 80,
  "items": [
    {
      "id": 4731946,
      "name": "tetris-c64",
...
```

But `RtPagination` expects an array:

``` java
            this.objects = new LinkedList<JsonObject>(
                response.as(JsonResponse.class).json()
                    .readArray().getValuesAs(JsonObject.class)
            );
```

If we could specify a property of an array of items in `RtPagination`, the problem would be resolved.
but do we need a pagination there? do they paginate search results?
